title: Contributing to iSEEhub
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("kevinrue/iSEEhub", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to iSEEhub
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Getting help with iSEEhub

title: Getting help with iSEEhub
text: Armed reprex, next step figure ask. See also Bioconductor help website. ’s question: start community.rstudio.com, /StackOverflow. Bioconductor-related question, please ask Bioconductor Support Website using appropriate package tag (website send automatic email package authors). people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Contributing to iSEEhub
text: Initial app configurations configure set panels respective initial state main iSEE app launched. Initial app configurations implemented R scripts stored inst/initial subdirectory iSEEhub package. Within directory, app expects subdirectory named exactly EH identifier dataset additional configurations made available. Within dataset-specific directory, app expects number R scripts, script defining one configuration. Contributions initial app configurations welcome iSEEhub pull requests, new configurations edits existing configurations.

title: Contributing to iSEEhub
text: initial configuration script must define least one object called initial, contains list instances panel classes defined iSEE package – -called built-panels – packages extend iSEE functionality. , packages like iSEEu iSEEhex. objects created configuration scripts ignored. encourage users refrain creating object initial, avoid unexpected behaviour app.

title: Contributing to iSEEhub
text: demonstration, package includes two configurations dataset EH1. scripts define configurations stored within directory inst/initial/EH1. Within directory, files named config_1.R config_error.R. script config_1.R defines initial app state contains one panel, namely ComplexHeatmapPlot, configured span half width app (6 12 units shiny units), displays metadata gender status color bars next heat map. Conversely, script config_error.R provides brutal example invalid script throws error. script included package test demonstrate app fails elegantly invalid configuration supplied (never happen first place).
code: ## EH1/config_1.R library(iSEE)  initial <- list(     ComplexHeatmapPlot(         PanelWidth = 6L,         ColumnData = c("gender", "tumor_status")     ) ) ## EH1/config_error.R # This script demonstrates how the app handles a bad configuration.  stop("Bad config script!")

title: Contributing to iSEEhub
text: Fork GitHub repository iSEEhub. Create /edit appropriate files directories within inst/initial directory. Test new configuration(s) locally; install updated iSEEhub package, launch app, load dataset(s) using new configuration(s). Open pull request GitHub repository iSEEhub. Wait maintainers review approve pull request.

title: Introduction to iSEEhub
text: iSEEhub extension iSEE Bioconductor package provides link iSEE Bioconductor ExperimentHub. Specifically, iSEEhub adds custom landing page iSEE web applications can used browse Bioconductor ExperimentHub interactively, loads selected data set standard iSEE user interface.

title: Introduction to iSEEhub
text: R open-source statistical environment can easily modified enhance functionality via packages. iSEEhub R package available via Bioconductor repository packages. R can installed operating system CRAN can install iSEEhub using following commands R session:
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {       install.packages("BiocManager")   }  BiocManager::install("iSEEhub")  ## Check that you have a valid Bioconductor installation BiocManager::valid()

what: Quick start to using to iSEEhub
title: Introduction to iSEEhub
text: main functionality package available function iSEEhub(). function returns shiny app can launched using function shiny::runApp().
code: library(iSEEhub) library(ExperimentHub) ehub <- ExperimentHub()  app <- iSEEhub(ehub)  if (interactive()) {   shiny::runApp(app, port = 1234) }

title: Introduction to iSEEhub
text: default, iSEEhub(..., runtime_install = FALSE) prevents app installing dependencies runtime. case, users identify missing dependency, must interrupt app, install required package(s) using R console, re-launch app. recommend approach applications hosted public web-servers.

title: Introduction to iSEEhub
text: Alternatively, iSEEhub(..., runtime_install = TRUE) can used launch app prompts users interactively (.e., within app) consent install missing dependencies. recommend approach applications run personal computers (unless users prefer install packages , course).

code: @Manual{,   title = {iSEEhub: iSEE for the Bioconductor ExperimentHub},   author = {Kevin Rue-Albrecht},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.7.1},   url = {https://github.com/iSEE/iSEEhub}, }

title: iSEE for the Bioconductor ExperimentHub
text: goal iSEEhub provide interface Bioconductor ExperimentHub directly within iSEE web-application. main functionality package define custom landing page allowing users browse Bioconductor ExperimentHub directly load objects iSEE web-application.

title: iSEE for the Bioconductor ExperimentHub
text: Get latest stable R release CRAN. install iSEEhub Bioconductor using following code: development version GitHub :
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {     install.packages("BiocManager") }  BiocManager::install("iSEEhub") BiocManager::install("iSEE/iSEEhub")

title: iSEE for the Bioconductor ExperimentHub
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library("iSEEhub") #> Warning: package 'BiocGenerics' was built under R version 4.2.1 #> Warning: package 'GenomeInfoDb' was built under R version 4.2.1 library(ExperimentHub) ehub <- ExperimentHub()  app <- iSEEhub(ehub)  if (interactive()) {   shiny::runApp(app, port = 1234) }
